post_title: Anyone interested in/know the value of 1983 Galasso Capital T206 set? - SOLD
post_content:
Just bought a large collection which had a ton of Bowman and other reprint sets.  Included was the 523 ct. 1983 Renata Galasso Capital T206 Reprint set.  This is the set without the perforated edges and has "CAPITAL REPRINT" on the baks of each card.  No comps on eBay but I feel I saw a few go last year for ~$100.  Any interest/comps/info?

FWIW set is nice and in 18 pocket pages.  If interested PM me with your email and I can email pics.  If I don't receive any interest I will post on eBay next week.

Thanks

I think I paid $100ish for a reprint set - it was really useful for me with figuring out what I had and what I needed and to be able to recognize cards on sight.  I would highly recommend having a reprint set if you are trying to put together the monster.  I sorted out all of the Hall of Famers, Southern Leaguers, Minor Leaguers, and Short prints and attacked it that way.

Mine also had a bonus card - Eddie Collins batting that I don't believe was produced in any form aside from proofs (Charlie Sheen owned it, and I want to say that Keith Olberman has it now?).  I don't think mine had the Joe Doyle NY Natl.

Here's a link to the Collins - 

[url]https://www.t206museum.com/page/ga_proofscollins.html[/url]

I'm interested. My email is [url]camdendad4439@gmail.com[/url] 

Sent from my SM-S908U using Tapatalk

[quote name="Cory" post=2393185]I think I paid $100ish for a reprint set - it was really useful for me with figuring out what I had and what I needed and to be able to recognize cards on sight.  I would highly recommend having a reprint set if you are trying to put together the monster.  I sorted out all of the Hall of Famers, Southern Leaguers, Minor Leaguers, and Short prints and attacked it that way.

Mine also had a bonus card - Eddie Collins batting that I don't believe was produced in any form aside from proofs (Charlie Sheen owned it, and I want to say that Keith Olberman has it now?).  I don't think mine had the Joe Doyle NY Natl.

Here's a link to the Collins - 

[url]https://www.t206museum.com/page/ga_proofscollins.html[/url][/QUOTE]

Yeah...Beckett has it at 526 total cards...but says the set is 520....really the main set is 523 with three variations (which I do not have).  The set is in order of the checklist so yes....would be super helpful for you pre-war guys.
Set is SOLD...Thanks to those that reached out and left comments!

Is there anywhere to get this
Eddie Collins batting that I don't believe was produced in any form aside from proofs. As a reprint of course?

Sent from my SM-S908U using Tapatalk
